alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 12:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Alleghany County in west central Virginia, northeastern Giles and Craig Counties in southwestern Virginia, northwestern Bath County in west central Virginia, southeastern Greenbrier and eastern Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 100 PM EDT... At 1223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rorer to Organ Cave to Waiteville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... Union... New Castle... and Paint Bank. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
